title: Mass communications and society: a mirror held up to reality
creator_credit: John Miller, BBC-TV and Open University
brief_description: First in a series of four films shot in Kansas City in August 1976, showing the ABC’s television coverage of the Republican Convention. The key areas are shown and the main figures explain their role and attitude towards the politicians and towards their competitors in the other networks. Also shown are the final editorial briefing and the production meeting, as well as the arrivals and speeches of Ronald Reagan and President ford.
